CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: For unipolar transport in a trap - free semiconductor with an ohmic injecting contact , the SCLC can be approximated by the Mott - Gurney equation : ε ε μ γ ≅ ⎛ ⎝ ⎜ ⎞ ⎠ ⎟ J V L V L 9^8 exp 0.891 r 0^0 2^3 ( 3 ) Here J is the current density , ε r is the dielectric constant of the polymer , ε 0 is the free - space permittivity ( 8.85 × 10^-12 F / m ) , μ 0 is the charge mobility at zero field , γ is a constant , L is the thickness of the blended film layer , V = V appl - V bi , V appl is the applied potential , and V bi is the built-in potential which results from the difference in the work function of the anode and the cathode ( in this device structure , V bi = 0.2 V ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Dielectric constant of the polymer: ε\_r
2. Free-space permittivity: ε\_0 (has a specific value mentioned in the text)
3. Charge mobility at zero field: μ\_0
4. Thickness of the blended film layer: L
5. Applied potential: V\_appl
6. Built-in potential: V\_bi

These are the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Dielectric constant of the polymer: ε\_r
2. Free-space permittivity: ε\_0
3. Thickness of the blended film layer: L

These are the relevant "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| dielectric constant of the polymer: ε\_r |
| free-space permittivity: ε\_0 |
| thickness of the blended film layer: L |

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: For unipolar transport in a trap - free semiconductor with an ohmic injecting contact , the SCLC can be approximated by the Mott - Gurney equation : ε ε μ γ ≅ ⎛ ⎝ ⎜ ⎞ ⎠ ⎟ J V L V L 9^8 exp 0.891 r 0^0 2^3 ( 3 ) Here J is the current density , ε r is the dielectric constant of the polymer , ε 0 is the free - space permittivity ( 8.85 × 10^-12 F / m ) , μ 0 is the charge mobility at zero field , γ is a constant , L is the thickness of the blended film layer , V = V appl - V bi , V appl is the applied potential , and V bi is the built-in potential which results from the difference in the work function of the anode and the cathode ( in this device structure , V bi = 0.2 V ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Current density: J
2. Dielectric constant of the polymer: ε\_r
3. Free-space permittivity: ε\_0
4. Charge mobility at zero field: μ\_0
5. A constant: γ
6. Thickness of the blended film layer: L
7. Applied potential: V\_appl
8. Built-in potential: V\_bi
9. Work function difference of the anode and the cathode: (in this device structure, V\_bi = 0.2 V)

These nine entities can be considered as "Property Name" entities in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. Dielectric constant of the polymer: ε\_r
2. Free-space permittivity: ε\_0 (though it is a universal constant, it is used in context of material properties)
3. Charge mobility at zero field: μ\_0
4. Thickness of the blended film layer: L

These four entities can be considered as Material Property entities in the given paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Dielectric constant of the polymer: ε\_r |
| Free-space permittivity: ε\_0 |
| Charge mobility at zero field: μ\_0 |
| Thickness of the blended film layer: L |
